intro: Ectrosia confusa, commonly known as the confused ectrosia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded forest environments. Its botanical features include palmate leaflets and a distinct, fragrant floral structure. Ectrosia confusa is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
